text: we're told that these are the last of
the civilians who were trapped inside
mouadamiya since march only a few
thousand were able to escape look at the
people who are coming out now they're
coming on wheelchairs on stretchers
desperate for food desperate for water
desperate for medical help people with
the Syrian Arab Red Crescent are here to
provide some immediate relief thousands
of people have been coming from la de
mia in the time that we've been here now
they're being taken to a safe shelter
run by the government this is the human
cost of a punishing war the rebel
fighters who are in control of
mouadamiya nearby blame the government
for laying siege to this neighborhood
the government says it's the fault of
the rebels for infiltrating the
neighborhood and taking up positions
inside the homes whoever is to blame
it's these people who've been made to
suffer they're now getting on buses
which are parked just behind us here and
nobody can say for sure how long they'll
have to stay in their shelters and when
they'll ever be able to go home
